apple.recipe:
Raw Apple: Wash and eat fresh, or slice thinly.
Apple Sauce: Peel, core, and cook diced apples with 2 tbsp water for 5-7 minutes until soft. Serve warm or cold.
apple.benefits: Rich in fiber and vitamin C. Supports digestion, heart health, and blood sugar control. Antioxidants reduce inflammation.
apple.diabetes_note: Good for diabetes - low glycemic index
apple.obesity_note: Low calorie, high fiber - great for weight loss

banana.recipe:
Fresh Banana: Peel and eat as is.
Banana Smoothie: Blend 1 banana with 1/2 cup yogurt and 1/2 cup milk. Add berries if desired.
Banana Oats: Slice banana into oatmeal porridge.
banana.benefits: High in potassium for heart health. Natural sugars for energy. Contains magnesium for muscle and nerve function.
banana.bp_note: Rich in potassium - helps regulate blood pressure
banana.diabetes_note: Monitor portions due to natural sugars

oats.recipe:
Basic Oatmeal: Mix 1/2 cup oats with 1 cup milk/water. Cook on medium heat 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Toppings: Add fresh fruits, nuts, honey, or cinnamon.
Oats with Veggies: Savoury option with cooked vegetables.
oats.benefits: High soluble fiber lowers cholesterol. Keeps you full longer. Provides sustained energy. Supports healthy blood sugar levels.
oats.bp_note: Helps lower blood pressure and cholesterol
oats.heart_note: Beta-glucan fiber reduces heart disease risk

egg.recipe:
Boiled Egg: Place eggs in cold water, bring to boil, cook 7-8 minutes for hard boiled. Cool in ice water, peel gently.
Scrambled: Beat eggs, cook in non-stick pan with minimal oil, add spinach or vegetables.
Omelette: Beat eggs, cook in pan, fill with vegetables and fold.
egg.benefits: Complete protein with all 9 amino acids. Contains choline for brain health. Rich in lutein for eye health. Very filling.
egg.bp_note: Good protein source, limit to 1-2 eggs for BP
egg.diabetes_note: Excellent protein - no impact on blood sugar
egg.heart_note: Choose boiled over fried for heart health
egg.obesity_note: High protein keeps you full, aids weight loss

watermelon.recipe:
Fresh Slices: Cut into wedges or cubes and serve chilled.
Watermelon Juice: Blend fresh watermelon, strain if desired, serve immediately.
Watermelon Salad: Combine cubes with mint and lemon juice.
watermelon.benefits: 92% water - excellent for hydration. Low in calories. Rich in lycopene (antioxidant). Vitamin A and C support immunity.
watermelon.obesity_note: Very low calorie, satisfying sweet treat

spinach.recipe:
Sautéed Spinach: Heat 1 tbsp oil, add spinach, cook 2-3 minutes, add garlic and salt.
Spinach Smoothie: Blend with banana, milk, and honey.
Spinach Salad: Eat fresh with olive oil and lemon dressing.
spinach.benefits: Iron-rich for blood health. Contains lutein for eyes. Packed with antioxidants. Rich in calcium and magnesium.
spinach.bp_note: High in potassium and magnesium for BP control

broccoli.recipe:
Steamed Broccoli: Cut into florets, steam 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp. Serve with lemon.
Roasted: Toss with olive oil and herbs, roast at 400°F for 15 minutes.
Broccoli Soup: Steam broccoli, blend with vegetable broth.
broccoli.benefits: Rich in vitamin C and K. Contains sulforaphane (cancer-fighting). Supports bone health. High in fiber.
broccoli.diabetes_note: Perfect for diabetes - high fiber, low carb

carrot.recipe:
Raw Carrots: Wash, peel, cut into sticks as snack.
Cooked Carrots: Steam for 5-7 minutes or roast with olive oil at 400°F for 20 minutes.
Carrot Juice: Blend raw carrots with water or apple juice.
carrot.benefits: High in beta-carotene for eye health. Supports immune system. Promotes skin health. High in fiber.
carrot.diabetes_note: Moderate portions due to natural sugars

yogurt.recipe:
Plain Yogurt: Eat with fresh fruits and berries.
Yogurt Parfait: Layer yogurt with granola and fresh fruits.
Yogurt Dressing: Mix with herbs for salad dressing.
yogurt.benefits: Probiotic source for digestive health. High in protein and calcium. Supports bone health and muscle strength.
yogurt.heart_note: Probiotics may reduce heart disease risk

rice.recipe:
White Rice: Boil in 2:1 water ratio for 18-20 minutes. Brown Rice: Same method but cook for 25-30 minutes.
Fried Rice: Cook rice, then stir-fry with vegetables and minimal oil.
rice.benefits: Gluten-free carbohydrate. Provides quick energy. Easy to digest. Versatile base for meals.

cucumber.recipe:
Fresh Cucumber: Wash, slice, eat as snack or in salads.
Cucumber Water: Add slices to water for flavor.
Cooled Salad: Dice and mix with yogurt, herbs, and lemon.
cucumber.benefits: 96% water - excellent hydration. Very low in calories. Contains antioxidants. Supports digestion.
cucumber.bp_note: Perfect for BP - hydrating, low sodium

tomato.recipe:
Fresh Tomato: Slice and eat raw, or add to salads.
Tomato Sauce: Cook diced tomatoes with garlic and herbs for 10 minutes.
Tomato Soup: Blend cooked tomatoes with vegetable broth.
tomato.benefits: Rich in lycopene (antioxidant). High in vitamin C. Supports heart health. Good for blood pressure.
tomato.diabetes_note: Low glycemic - good for blood sugar

orange.recipe:
Fresh Orange: Peel and eat segments.
Orange Juice: Extract juice from 2-3 oranges, drink fresh.
Orange Salad: Mix segments with other fruits.
orange.benefits: High in vitamin C for immunity. Contains fiber for digestion. Natural antioxidants. Supports skin health.
orange.obesity_note: Fiber-rich, eat whole fruit not juice

milk.recipe:
Fresh Milk: Drink plain or warm.
Milk with Turmeric: Warm milk with 1/2 tsp turmeric powder.
Milk Smoothie: Blend with banana or berries.
milk.benefits: Rich in calcium for bones. Complete protein source. Vitamin D for immunity. Supports muscle health.

chicken.recipe:
Grilled Chicken: Marinate with herbs, grill 6-7 minutes per side.
Boiled Chicken: Cook in water with salt for 20-25 minutes.
Chicken Curry: Cook with tomatoes, onions, and spices.
chicken.benefits: High-quality lean protein. Rich in B vitamins. Supports muscle growth. Low in saturated fat.
chicken.bp_note: Remove skin, avoid salt during cooking
chicken.diabetes_note: Excellent protein - no blood sugar impact

fish.recipe:
Grilled Fish: Season with lemon and herbs, grill 5 minutes per side.
Steamed Fish: Steam with ginger for 10-12 minutes.
Fish Curry: Cook in coconut milk with spices.
fish.benefits: Rich in omega-3 fatty acids. Heart-healthy protein. Brain health support. Anti-inflammatory properties.
fish.bp_note: Excellent for BP - omega-3s benefit heart
fish.heart_note: Omega-3s reduce heart disease risk significantly

lentils.recipe:
Boiled Lentils: Rinse and boil in 3:1 water ratio for 20-25 minutes.
Lentil Soup: Cook with vegetables and spices.
Lentil Salad: Mix cooked lentils with vegetables.
lentils.benefits: High in plant protein and fiber. Rich in iron. Supports digestion. Stabilizes blood sugar.
lentils.heart_note: Fiber and folate support heart health

beans.recipe:
Boiled Beans: Soak overnight, boil for 45-60 minutes.
Bean Salad: Mix cooked beans with vegetables and dressing.
Bean Curry: Cook with tomatoes and spices.
beans.benefits: High in protein and fiber. Rich in minerals. Supports heart health. Keeps you full longer.

sweet potato.recipe:
Baked Sweet Potato: Bake at 400°F for 45 minutes.
Boiled: Cook in water for 20-25 minutes.
Mashed: Boil and mash with minimal butter.
sweet potato.benefits: Rich in beta-carotene. High in fiber. Natural sweetness. Supports eye health.
sweet potato.diabetes_note: Better than white potato - lower GI

quinoa.recipe:
Cooked Quinoa: Rinse and cook in 2:1 water ratio for 15 minutes.
Quinoa Salad: Mix with vegetables and lemon dressing.
Quinoa Bowl: Top with vegetables and protein.
quinoa.benefits: Complete protein with all amino acids. Gluten-free. High in fiber. Rich in minerals.

almonds.recipe:
Raw Almonds: Eat 8-10 almonds as snack.
Almond Milk: Blend soaked almonds with water, strain.
Chopped: Sprinkle on yogurt or oatmeal.
almonds.benefits: Heart-healthy fats. Rich in vitamin E. Protein and fiber. Supports brain health.

walnuts.recipe:
Raw Walnuts: Eat 4-5 halves daily.
Chopped: Add to salads or oatmeal.
Walnut Powder: Grind and add to smoothies.
walnuts.benefits: Omega-3 fatty acids. Brain health support. Anti-inflammatory. Heart-healthy.

papaya.recipe:
Fresh Papaya: Cut in half, remove seeds, eat with spoon.
Papaya Smoothie: Blend with milk or yogurt.
Papaya Salad: Mix cubes with lime juice.
papaya.benefits: Rich in papain enzyme for digestion. High in vitamin C. Supports immunity. Anti-inflammatory.

grapes.recipe:
Fresh Grapes: Wash and eat as snack.
Grape Juice: Blend fresh grapes, strain if desired.
Frozen Grapes: Freeze for a cool treat.
grapes.benefits: Rich in antioxidants. Supports heart health. Hydrating. Natural energy boost.

pomegranate.recipe:
Fresh Arils: Cut and extract seeds to eat.
Pomegranate Juice: Blend arils and strain.
Salad Topping: Sprinkle arils on salads.
pomegranate.benefits: Powerful antioxidants. Supports heart health. Anti-inflammatory. Rich in vitamin C.

avocado.recipe:
Fresh Avocado: Slice and eat with salt and pepper.
Guacamole: Mash with lime, onion, tomato, cilantro.
Avocado Toast: Spread on whole grain bread.
avocado.benefits: Healthy monounsaturated fats. High in potassium. Rich in fiber. Supports nutrient absorption.

salmon.recipe:
Baked Salmon: Season with lemon, bake at 400°F for 12-15 minutes.
Grilled: Grill 4-5 minutes per side.
Salmon Salad: Flake cooked salmon over greens.
salmon.benefits: Highest in omega-3 EPA and DHA. High-quality protein. Rich in B vitamins. Supports brain health.

tuna.recipe:
Grilled Tuna: Grill 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Tuna Salad: Mix with yogurt, celery, onion.
Tuna Sandwich: Use on whole grain bread.
tuna.benefits: High protein, low fat. Rich in selenium. Omega-3 fatty acids. Supports metabolism.

shrimp.recipe:
Grilled Shrimp: Marinate with garlic and lemon, grill 2-3 minutes per side.
Boiled Shrimp: Boil in seasoned water for 2-3 minutes.
Shrimp Stir-fry: Quick cook with vegetables.
shrimp.benefits: Very high protein, very low fat. Rich in selenium. Contains astaxanthin antioxidant. Low calorie.

turkey.recipe:
Roasted Turkey: Season and roast at 350°F, 20 minutes per pound.
Turkey Burger: Form patties, grill 5-6 minutes per side.
Turkey Stir-fry: Slice and cook with vegetables.
turkey.benefits: Lean protein. Rich in tryptophan. Contains selenium. Supports muscle health.
turkey.heart_note: Lower in saturated fat than red meat

tofu.recipe:
Pan-fried Tofu: Press to remove water, slice, pan-fry until golden.
Tofu Scramble: Crumble and cook like scrambled eggs.
Tofu Soup: Add cubes to miso or vegetable soup.
tofu.benefits: Plant-based complete protein. Contains all 9 amino acids. Rich in calcium and iron. Low in calories.

peanuts.recipe:
Roasted Peanuts: Roast at 350°F for 15-20 minutes.
Peanut Butter: Blend roasted peanuts until smooth.
Peanut Snack: Eat handful as snack.
peanuts.benefits: High in protein and healthy fats. Rich in vitamin E. Contains resveratrol. Good energy source.

kale.recipe:
Sautéed Kale: Remove stems, sauté in oil with garlic 5 minutes.
Kale Salad: Massage raw kale with oil and lemon.
Kale Chips: Bake at 350°F for 10-15 minutes.
kale.benefits: Nutrient powerhouse. High in vitamins K, A, C. Contains antioxidants. Anti-inflammatory.

cauliflower.recipe:
Roasted Cauliflower: Toss with oil, roast at 425°F for 25 minutes.
Cauliflower Rice: Pulse in food processor, sauté 5 minutes.
Mashed: Steam and mash like potatoes.
cauliflower.benefits: Low carb vegetable. High in fiber and vitamin C. Contains sulforaphane. Supports detoxification.

bell pepper.recipe:
Stuffed Peppers: Fill with rice and meat, bake 30 minutes.
Roasted: Roast at 450°F for 20 minutes.
Fresh: Slice and eat raw with hummus.
bell pepper.benefits: Very high in vitamin C. Contains carotenoids. Low in calories. Supports eye health.
bell pepper.bp_note: High in vitamin C and potassium

zucchini.recipe:
Zucchini Noodles: Spiralize and sauté 2-3 minutes.
Grilled Zucchini: Slice, grill 3-4 minutes per side.
Zucchini Bread: Bake with whole wheat flour.
zucchini.benefits: Very low in calories. High water content. Contains vitamin C and potassium. Easy to digest.

mushrooms.recipe:
Sautéed Mushrooms: Slice and cook in butter/oil 5-7 minutes.
Grilled: Marinate and grill whole caps 5 minutes.
Mushroom Soup: Cook and blend with broth.
mushrooms.benefits: Low calorie, high umami flavor. Contains B vitamins. Source of vitamin D. Immune support.
mushrooms.obesity_note: Adds volume and flavor, low calorie

onion.recipe:
Caramelized Onions: Cook slowly on low heat 30-40 minutes.
Raw: Slice thin for salads and sandwiches.
Sautéed: Cook in oil 5-7 minutes until soft.
onion.benefits: Contains quercetin antioxidant. Supports immune health. Anti-inflammatory. Adds flavor without calories.

garlic.recipe:
Roasted Garlic: Roast whole head at 400°F for 40 minutes.
Minced: Sauté minced garlic in oil 30 seconds.
Raw: Add to dressings and sauces.
garlic.benefits: Powerful antimicrobial. Contains allicin. Supports immune system. Anti-inflammatory.

ginger.recipe:
Ginger Tea: Steep fresh slices in hot water 10 minutes.
Stir-fry: Add minced ginger to cooking.
Ginger Juice: Blend and strain fresh ginger.
ginger.benefits: Powerful anti-inflammatory. Aids digestion. May reduce nausea. Supports immune health.

turmeric.recipe:
Golden Milk: Mix 1 tsp turmeric in warm milk.
Curry: Add to curry dishes.
Turmeric Rice: Add 1/2 tsp when cooking rice.
turmeric.benefits: Contains curcumin, powerful anti-inflammatory. Antioxidant. Supports brain health. May reduce chronic disease risk.

green tea.recipe:
Hot Green Tea: Steep tea bag in hot water 3-5 minutes.
Iced Green Tea: Brew strong, pour over ice.
Green Tea Smoothie: Blend cooled tea with fruit.
green tea.benefits: Rich in catechins (antioxidants). Boosts metabolism. Supports brain function. May aid fat burning.
green tea.obesity_note: May boost metabolism and fat burning

berries.recipe:
Fresh Berries: Wash and eat as snack.
Berry Smoothie: Blend with yogurt and milk.
Berry Salad: Mix with other fruits.
berries.benefits: Highest antioxidant fruits. High in fiber. Low glycemic. Supports brain health.
berries.diabetes_note: Best fruit choice for blood sugar

chia seeds.recipe:
Chia Pudding: Mix 3 tbsp chia with 1 cup milk, refrigerate overnight.
Chia Water: Mix 1 tbsp in water, let sit 10 minutes.
Sprinkle: Add to yogurt, oatmeal, smoothies.
chia seeds.benefits: Very high in omega-3 ALA. Rich in fiber. Complete protein. Absorbs liquid to keep you full.

flaxseeds.recipe:
Ground Flaxseed: Grind fresh and add to smoothies, yogurt.
Flax Egg: Mix 1 tbsp ground flax with 3 tbsp water.
Baking: Add to muffins and breads.
flaxseeds.benefits: Richest plant source of omega-3 ALA. High in lignans (antioxidants). Excellent fiber. Supports hormone balance.
flaxseeds.bp_note: One of best foods for lowering BP

oat bran.recipe:
Cooked Oat Bran: Mix 1/3 cup with 1 cup water, cook 5 minutes.
Baking: Add to muffins and breads.
Sprinkle: Add to yogurt or smoothies.
oat bran.benefits: Even higher in soluble fiber than oats. Powerful cholesterol-lowering effect. Supports digestion.
oat bran.heart_note: Most effective food for lowering cholesterol
